ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Trouble restarting heritrix daemon
ygData.msgSnippet: The problem isn t with your shutdown; rather there s a bug preventing settings of NotMatchesListRegExpDecideRule from being recognized. (I presume you added

The problem isn't with your shutdown; rather there's a bug preventing 
settings of NotMatchesListRegExpDecideRule from being recognized.

(I presume you added your root:scope:rules:7:regexp-list value by 
hand-editting the sheet, because the same bug should prevent the web UI 
from showing an option to edit that value.)

I've created an issue for the bug:

http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-1593

This could be fixed in a future patch release; however, we haven't yet 
set a target date for such a release against 2.0.x.

Do you need 2.X features -- highly customizable queue prioritization?

If not, I recommend sticking with 1.14.x releases until 2.2 comes out -- 
they are better documented and have fewer of these gotcha bugs.

- Gordon @ IA

sylvainaparis wrote:
> Hi list,
> 
> I'm running heritrix-2.0.2.
> 
> I'm having trouble restarting heritrix. I stopped it with the kill
> command (with the default TERM signal).
> 
> Now when I want to restart it, every sheets are tagged with
> "validation problems". I can reproduce it with any new installation
> and any sheet including the NotMatchesListRegExpDecideRule rule.
> 
> Editing the not validated sheet, I get these errors in red at the
> bottom of the page :
> 
> list-logical-or     global
> Problem: No such key: root:scope:rules:7:list-logical-or
> This invalid setting will be automatically removed when you modify this 
> sheet.
> details
> enabled    global
> Problem: No such key: root:scope:rules:7:enabled
> This invalid setting will be automatically removed when you modify this 
> sheet.
> details
> decision    global
> Problem: No such key: root:scope:rules:7:decision
> This invalid setting will be automatically removed when you modify this 
> sheet.
> details
> regexp-list    global
> Problem: No such key: root:scope:rules:7:regexp-list
> This invalid setting will be automatically removed when you modify this 
> sheet.
> list of Pattern details
> 0    global
> Problem: org.archive.settings.path.InvalidPathException: 
> root:scope:rules:7:regexp-list is invalid because 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.NotMatchesListRegExpDecideRule does not 
> define a key named regexp-list
> This invalid setting will be automatically removed when you modify this 
> sheet.
> 
> Here is the relevant part of the sheet :
> 
> root=map, java.lang.Object
> root:metadata=primary, org.archive.modules.writer.DefaultMetadataProvider
> root:metadata:description=string, Basic seeds sites crawl.
> root:metadata:http-user-agent=string, Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; Mozilla 
> Gecko heritrix/@VERSION@ +@OPERATOR_CONTACT_URL@)
> root:metadata:operator-contact-url=string, 
> http://homepage.fr/
> root:metadata:operator-name=string, me myself and i
> root:metadata:organization=string, my OU
> root:metadata:robots-honoring-policy=primary, 
> org.archive.modules.net.RobotsHonoringPolicy
> root:metadata:robots-honoring-policy:user-agents=list, java.lang.String
> root:loggerModule=primary,
> org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlerLoggerModule
> root:seeds=primary, org.archive.modules.seeds.SeedModuleImpl
> root:scope=object, org.archive.modules.deciderules.DecideRuleSequence
> root:scope:rules=list, org.archive.modules.deciderules.DecideRule
> root:scope:rules:0=object,
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.RejectDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:1=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.surt.SurtPrefixedDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:1:also-check-via=boolean, false
> root:scope:rules:1:decision=enum, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.DecideResult-ACCEPT
> root:scope:rules:1:rebuild-on-reconfig=boolean, true
> root:scope:rules:1:seeds-as-surt-prefixes=boolean, true
> root:scope:rules:2=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.TooManyHopsDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:3=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.TransclusionDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:4=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.PathologicalPathDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:5=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.TooManyPathSegmentsDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:6=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.MatchesListRegExpDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:6:decision=enum, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.DecideResult-REJECT
> root:scope:rules:6:enabled=boolean, true
> root:scope:rules:6:list-logical-or=boolean, true
> root:scope:rules:6:regexp-list=list, java.util.regex.Pattern
> root:scope:rules:6:regexp-list:0=pattern, .*//[^/]+/(contenu|author)/.*
> root:scope:rules:6:regexp-list:1=pattern, 
> ...*\.(jpg|png|gif|css|ico|JPG|PNG|GIF|CSS|ICO)$
> root:scope:rules:6:regexp-list:2=pattern, .*//[^/]+\.\d+/.*
> root:scope:rules:6:regexp-list:3=pattern, 
> ...*/(sitemap|author|copyright)$
> root:scope:rules:6:regexp-list:4=pattern, 
> ...*(_image_popup|login_form|require_login)\?.*
> root:scope:rules:7=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.NotMatchesListRegExpDecideRule
> root:scope:rules:7:decision=enum, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.DecideResult-REJECT
> root:scope:rules:7:enabled=boolean, true
> root:scope:rules:7:list-logical-or=boolean, true
> root:scope:rules:7:regexp-list=list, java.util.regex.Pattern
> root:scope:rules:7:regexp-list:0=pattern, 
> ...*//[^/]+/(intranet/Site_National).*
> root:scope:rules:8=object, 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.PrerequisiteAcceptDecideRule
> root:uriUniqFilter=primary, org.archive.crawler.util.BdbUriUniqFilter
> root:queue-assignment-policy=primary, 
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.SurtAuthorityQueueAssignmentPolicy
> root:server-cache=primary, org.archive.modules.net.BdbServerCache
> root:credential-store=primary, 
> org.archive.modules.credential.CredentialStore
> root:controller=primary, org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlControllerImpl
> root:controller:frontier=primary, org.archive.crawler.frontier.BdbFrontier
> 
> It seems that the error is here : regexp-list is invalid because 
> org.archive.modules.deciderules.NotMatchesListRegExpDecideRule does
> not define a key named regexp-list
> 
> Is that true ? Are my rules wrong, or is that a bug at loading time ?
> 
> Regards,
> Sylvain
